abstract: Andrew M. Cuomo wants to know if Bank of America directors were misled or “little more than rubber stamps” for management.
snippet: Andrew M. Cuomo wants to know if Bank of America directors were misled or “little more than rubber stamps” for management.
lead_paragraph: Capping a week of scrutiny for Bank of America, New York Attorney General Andrew M. Cuomo took another swing on Wednesday at uncovering which of the bank’s executives knew about large losses and bonus payouts at Merrill Lynch just before the two banks merged last year.

headline.main: Cuomo Is Said to Issue Subpoenas in Merrill Case
headline.print_headline: Cuomo Is Said to Issue Subpoenas in Merrill Case

abstract: The Singapore sovereign wealth fund said net profit fell a record 67 percent in the year ended March 31, as a collapse in credit markets drove down the value of its stakes including holdings in Bank of America and Barclays.
snippet: The Singapore sovereign wealth fund said net profit fell a record 67 percent in the year ended March 31, as a collapse in credit markets drove down the value of its stakes including holdings in Bank of America and Barclays.
lead_paragraph: Temasek Holdings, a Singapore sovereign wealth fund, said net profit fell a record 67 percent in the year ended March 31, as a collapse in credit markets drove down the value of its stakes including holdings in Bank of America and Barclays.

headline.main: Temasek Sees Profit Slide Amid Downturn

abstract: A family of funds uses a kind of arbitrary pricing that the S.E.C. threw out in the 1960s.
snippet: A family of funds uses a kind of arbitrary pricing that the S.E.C. threw out in the 1960s.
lead_paragraph: It’s been four decades since the go-go years of the late 1960s, when hot mutual funds captured the imagination of investors by reporting performance that was too good to be true.

abstract: Kenneth R. Feinberg is planning to disclose the salaries for the 25 most highly paid employees at many major companies, according to TheStreet.com.
snippet: Kenneth R. Feinberg is planning to disclose the salaries for the 25 most highly paid employees at many major companies, according to TheStreet.com.
lead_paragraph: Kenneth R. Feinberg, the Obama administration’s executive pay czar, is planning to disclose the salaries for the 25 most highly paid employees at a variety of companies within 30 days, according to TheStreet.com, citing comments attributed to him in an analyst’s research report. They include Citigroup, Bank of America, the American International Group, GMAC, Chrysler Financial, General Motors and Chrysler.

headline.main: Pay Czar Said to Plan to Disclose Top Salaries
